summary: Oil and gas leases on federal land generate billions of dollars in revenues to the government. Lease holders typically have 10 years to begin drilling for oil and gas. However, the clock is stopped (sometimes for decades) and payments can be halted if the Bureau of Land Management suspends the lease—for example, due to permit issues or environmental reviews. title: Oil and Gas Lease Management: BLM Could Improve Oversight of Lease Suspensions with Better Data and Monitoring Procedures
